                                \_/
Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Fri Jul 22 13:40:17 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

You turn to page Ten.
read book
An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 10
Module Transports:
Four-Person Accord Space Module Transport 20000000.00 (AFW Command)
AFW SPACE MODULE TRANSPORT
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 20 industry points      0 combat points
Model number: AFW-063                   Designation: Accord Space Module
Transport
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 12000        Standard battery hours: 18
Docking bay size required: 160
This ship will allow you to move around temporary space station modules and
position them properly so that you can create a temporary space structure in the
sector of your choice. Despite being a light cruiser, this vessel does not have
a docking bay, replacing the dockin bay with the module bay. It can hold up to
28 temporary space station modules.
Two-Person Accord Space Module Scout 20,000,000.00 (AFW Command)
AFW SPACE MODULE SCOUT
Class: Scout
Requirements: 20 industry points        300 exploration points
Model number: AFW-071                   Designation: Accord Space Module Scout
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 4000         Standard battery hours: 20
Docking bay size required: 60
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
This ship, though smaller than its cousin and able to fit only seven temporary
space station modules has two hours more charge, and also has an exploration
point requirement. Even with this exploration point requirement however, it does
not seem like this ship has exploration-grade sensors, and cannot be fitted with
an impeller upgrade.
AC-2X SPACE CONSTRUCTOR 100,000,000.00 (Aenea)
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 2500 industry points
Model number: AC-2X                     Designation: Space Constructor
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 10000        Standard battery hours: 12
Docking bay size required: 225
This vessel is able to hold 28 temporary space station modules, just like the
module transport. However, this particular design which is currently only
available to the AEU, has the added benefits of not needing space lifters at all
for temporary station construction. This is because you can construct the
temporary stations from inside the docking bay, and thenjust push the station
itself out when you need to. It appears that you can have more than one
temporary station constructed and ready for deployment in the module bay at any
given time, but the modules used in the construction will still count towards
the module bay's total limit.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "The advantage to a carrier though of
course as you can dock a larger trade ship and a combat ship or a trade ship and
a module transporter."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "The scout."
nod lily
You nod to Lily Kaise.

read book
An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 7
Carrier Starships:
There are many different ships that have docking bays, and all can carry up to
certain ship classes. I will only list on this page starships that are actually
purposed to be carriers more than anything else. Note: carrier starships
currently cannot hold ships such as cruisers and module transports.
Five-Person Hyperion Security Tactical Deployment Vessel 40,000,000.00
(Hyperion)
HX-7 HYPERION CORPORATE SECURITY TACTICAL DEPLOYMENT VESSEL
Class: Gunship
Requirements: 250 industry points       100 combat points
Model number: HX-7                      Designation: Hyperion Security Tactical
Deployment Vessel
Turret hardpoints: 6                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 16
Docking bay size required: 112.5           Docking bay capacity: 75
Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
I invision this ship as one that can hold its own as long as it takes for it to
jump into a sector and deploy smaller starcraft to fight in a battle. Each
weapons room has only two turrets in it, so it should not be used for a long
fight. It cannot hold as many ships as the carrier, due to its smaller number of
available docking units.
Four-Person Light Carrier 150,000,000.00 (Drydock)
CMY-96 COALITION LIGHT CARRIER
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 500 industry points       350 combat points
Model number: CMY-96                    Designation: Light Carrier
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 2000         Standard battery hours: 18
Docking bay size required: 150          Docking bay capacity: 100
This ship can dock almost every type of ship into its abnormally large docking
bay, right up to and including gunship-class vessels.
Two-Person Tugboat 10,000,000.00 (AFW Command)
AFW ACCORD STANDARD TUGBOAT
Class: Scout
Requirements: 0 industry points         0 combat points
Model number: AFW-044                   Designation: Tugboat
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 8000         Standard battery hours: 6
Docking bay size required: 12.5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110~%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95~%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
The tugboat doesn't have a docking bay to hold ships in, but it can tow a ship
to most desired destinations, enabling them to even travel through a wormhole
while they are being towed. Note: ships tugged by your boat do not follow you
into the riftflow, don't waste your credits. Tugged ships will also not follow
you if you move between sectors via a reactionless drive either manually or
using autovector.
'looks like the carrier and mod transport have the same battery life.

containing blue and yellow aquatic life and multicolored round rocks, a small

and round rocks, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing ivory
and teal aquatic life and sea green and neon blue round rocks, a small orange
ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale pink ceramic
felo chow bowl, and Bert the hefty blue soldier felo here.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.
Would you like to request landing clearance at Old Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.

William Dove. The League welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
Lily Kaise glides in from the south.

curled loosely around her.
power

The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.

wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a backpack. You are concealing a
flight control scanner, a leather briefcase, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling
supply kit, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a black flightbag
with a red shooting star on the side, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black
engineering tool case, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, and a
scorched metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows,
both forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

charged.

[Starship "Kartal"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on yellow alert. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair here.

[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The five-person strike gunboat "Kartal" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, Purr the humanoid service robot,
and Jewel the large violet glowing felo here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[New Earth; Pilot Corps Liaison Office; Space Defense Captain]
This office is small but elegant, the recessed lighting shining softly over pale
green carpet, silvery white walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with
an ergonomically designed mesh and leather chair behind it. Arranged in front of
the desk are several other chairs, while ferns in white pots occupy the corners
of the office, and on the walls are framed images of sleek AEU starships. The
door is open.

ftl museum
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.

1
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Critical
Strike! Welcome to home space!"
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Critical Strike. We read your
AEU transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
n

n

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

read paper
--
Glyphmaker colors
green is blue and yellow Cancel with red
orange is red and yellow cancel with Blue
violet is red and blue cancel with Yellow
indigo is violet and blue cancelled by saffron
fuchsia is violet and red cancelled by chartreuse
ochre is violet and yellow
vermillion is orange and red cancelled by teal
saffron is orange and yellow cancelled by indigo
taupe is orange and blue
chartreuse is green and yellow cancelled by fuchsia
teal is green and blue cancelled by vermillion
sienna is green and red
blue cancel with Orange
Yellow cancel with Violet
If the glyph at the door flashes black, we cancel it. If white, we match it. So
if we get a red one, it'll flash black, flash a blue and a yellow. If we get an
indigo that flashes white, we first make a violet glyph, then a blue one. If
that indigo flashes black, we cancel it by making a saffron glyph (make an
orange glyph, then add yellow).
--
read second paper
--

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

[Site 118192412; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

You stand at the entrance to a subterranean tunnel. The radiation level is
somewhat reduced here. Deeper in the tunnel, you can expect to find mineral
deposits and perhaps one or two alien artifacts, from whichever species occupied
this world before humanity established a presence.

ABILITIES
--
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds
MAJOR REPAIR
   Greatly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MAJOR GROUP REPAIR
   Greatly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE
   Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
KNOCKOUT
   Makes a single target unresponsive indefinitely, or until it is hit.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 12 seconds
ADVANCED RESOURCE DETECTION
   Scans for various resources.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
BULK MINERAL EXTRACTION
   Extracts minerals from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
ACCELERATED RARE EARTHS EXTRACTION
   Extracts rare earths from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 6 seconds
SIMPLE ARTIFACT EXTRACTION
   Extracts artifacts from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 20 seconds

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

n
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

You press a button on an AEU Combat Universalist, which splits open down the
front. You carefully climb inside.
n
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.

You can go north and south.

preemptive repair, moderate repair, squad restoration, moderate group repair,
shake off, group pulse, major repair, confuse, major group repair, and knockout

Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.

[Site 118192412; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.
d
You move down.

peer w
You peer west...
[Site 118192412; Tunnel] (inside a battlesuit)
This is a large dark tunnel, exactly like the hundreds of others that permeate
this world. The stone above blocks some of the incoming radiation, but the heat
level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.
Markings on the ground show that this area has already been explored.
You see the wreckage of Poacher Drone Alpha and an energy bottle here.
You can go east and down.

23
ABILITIES
--
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds
MAJOR REPAIR
   Greatly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MAJOR GROUP REPAIR
   Greatly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE
   Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
KNOCKOUT
   Makes a single target unresponsive indefinitely, or until it is hit.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 12 seconds
ADVANCED RESOURCE DETECTION
   Scans for various resources.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
BULK MINERAL EXTRACTION
   Extracts minerals from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
ACCELERATED RARE EARTHS EXTRACTION
   Extracts rare earths from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 6 seconds
SIMPLE ARTIFACT EXTRACTION
   Extracts artifacts from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 20 seconds

n
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.

Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.

[Site 118192412; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

You move down.

[Site 118192412; Tunnel] (inside a battlesuit)
This is a large dark tunnel, exactly like the hundreds of others that permeate
this world. The stone above blocks some of the incoming radiation, but the heat
level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.
Markings on the ground show that this area has already been explored.

WEAPONS
--
CYCLONIC LASER
   Module:     Laser
   Ammunition: Unlimited         Time To Fire: 4 seconds       Shots Fired: 5
   Damage:     29 - 48           Splash Damage: none           Damage/Shot: 6 -
10
QUAD-LASER
   Module:     Laser
   Ammunition: Unlimited         Time To Fire: 6 seconds       Shots Fired: 4
   Damage:     54 - 90           Splash Damage: none           Damage/Shot: 14 -
23
ABILITIES
--
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds
MAJOR REPAIR
   Greatly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MAJOR GROUP REPAIR
   Greatly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE
   Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
KNOCKOUT
   Makes a single target unresponsive indefinitely, or until it is hit.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 12 seconds
ADVANCED RESOURCE DETECTION
   Scans for various resources.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
BULK MINERAL EXTRACTION
   Extracts minerals from the ground.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Site 118192412; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Teslatown; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The landing pad, like all exterior portions of the facility, is covered with a
giant Faraday cage which keeps out the electrical blasts that are hurled down
from the sky on a regular basis. To stand in when the cage is opened, such as
when a starship is departing or arriving, a number of tall lightning rods
surround the pad, each attached to a drooping grounding wire that buries itself
in the ground.
The two-person Accord gemini "Sg 8", the four-person mule "ShadowHawk", the
opochtli "Mouse Noise (Squeak Was Taken)", the two-person Accord gemini "Nebula
Flame", the two-person Accord gemini "Javelle", the two-person Accord gemini
"Infinite Joy", the one-person fighter "Until It Breaks", the two-person Accord
gemini "Remember What I Said", the one-person cargo hauler "Sprouting Wings",
and the four-person mule "Lidia's Pride" are landed here.
You see a battlesuit transportation technician here.
You can go east.

launch

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Lidia's Pride, you are given launch
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
ca.....................................................Cylinder Accelerator
f......................................................Powered Shotgun
y......................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dis....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
fl.....................................................Flare              
(Attracts attention from a group of enemies.)
fls....................................................Flash              
(Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop what
they were doing.)
ill....................................................Illuminate         
(Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.)
rad....................................................Radiate            
(Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.)
lg.....................................................Laser Guidance     
(Augments your squad's accuracy.)
bl.....................................................Blind              
(Blinds a single target for a period of time.)
df.....................................................Directed Flare     
(Irritates and provokes a single target.)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

You press a button on a League Knight, which splits open down the front. You

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
n

18
ABILITIES
--
FLARE
   Attracts attention from a group of enemies.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
FLASH
   Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop
what they were doing.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
ILLUMINATE
   Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
RADIATE
   Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
LASER GUIDANCE
   Augments your squad's accuracy.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 6 seconds
BLIND
   Blinds a single target for a period of time.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
DIRECTED FLARE
   Irritates and provokes a single target.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
ADVANCED RESOURCE DETECTION
   Scans for various resources.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
ACCELERATED RARE EARTHS EXTRACTION
   Extracts rare earths from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 6 seconds
SWIFT ARTIFACT EXTRACTION
   Extracts artifacts from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 10 seconds
Current Energy: 160/160

(20 seconds roundtime.)
Minor Change: Added a message beacon top module for temporary stations. It
transmits a message when a ship enters the sector. The message can be set with
the MESSAGE command in the control room. That's it.
[Site 123685342; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.

this world. The stone above blocks some of the incoming radiation, but the heat
level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.

Advanced Combat Armour), and a space-grade detonator here.

[Providence Station; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.

HYPERION SUPERCONDUCTING SINK (Endymion)

Overall Efficiency: 50% Combat Grid Usage: 125% Wormhole Drive Usage: 250% Max
Engine Speed: 8000km/s
Many pilots have approached me with complaints regarding batteries and how they
can know that a battery is good for them. Since a battery is such a vital
component to a ship's functioning at maximum efficiency, I will take the time to
talk about them in detail in this section.
The battery has three things that a pilot should look at. The overall efficiency
is the battery's charge. The higher the overall efficiency is, the greater your
ship charge will be.
Combat grid usage is how much of a battery will be used to recharge a combat
grid. The higher the combat grid usage is, the slower the grid will actually
recharge.
Wormhole drive usage is the amount of charge from a battery the wormhole drive
uses to make a jump point. The higher the wormhole drive usage is, the more
power a ship will use from the ship's batteries. For example, 250% will use
approximately 12 minutes of ship charge to make a wormhole jump.
Finally, we have maximum engine speed. It's not as some people believe, how fast
the ship will go when it's at full speed, but more how fast the ship will start
moving if it has an engine that has the same instantaneous velocity of a
battery's max engine speed. The instantaneous velocity of your ship will be the
instantaneous velocity of the slower component, whether that is the battery or
the engine.
tra 1 The feinstein one.

[Starship "Courageous"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You may not leave the ship until the airlock's environment matches the external
environment.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
You exit the ship.

CFY-39-III COALITION SPACE SUPERIORITY FIGHTER MK III
--
Class: Fighter

Model number: CFY-39-III                Designation: Fighter
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 10000        Standard battery hours: 2
Docking bay size required: 5
   Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 90%     
Instantaneous Speed: 105%               
--
The Mk II removed most of the flaws of the original Coalition fighter while
adding many useful technologies.  With the Mk III, we have refined our design
even further.  The Space Superiority Fighter is now the only choice for fast,
precision strikes against well-defended targets.

AC-2X SPACE CONSTRUCTOR
--
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 2500 industry points      
Model number: AC-2X                     Designation: Space Constructor
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 10000        Standard battery hours: 12
Docking bay size required: 225          Docking bay capacity: 15
--
Finding that constructing temporary stations on site in deep space is dangerous
and labor-intensive? This specially-designed station module transport has an
oversized module bay and section-specific artificial gravity generators that
allow you to build a station right in the module bay, then bring the completed
station to its intended site and launch it in a jiffy! The AEU civilian corps
has already emerged as a leader in space-based infrastructure, now cement your
position with this state-of-the-art construction vehicle!

[New Earth; Pilot Corps Liaison Office; Space Defense Captain]
This office is small but elegant, the recessed lighting shining softly over pale
green carpet, silvery white walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with
an ergonomically designed mesh and leather chair behind it. Arranged in front of
the desk are several other chairs, while ferns in white pots occupy the corners
of the office, and on the walls are framed images of sleek AEU starships. The
door is open.

You can go north, south, west, and down.
transport celtic
You cannot transport a ship that is powered up.

comm celtic
Commands for the advanced scout "Celtic Rose":
--
Unique   knock celtic                                                           
             cycle celtic
--
Common   get celtic                                                             
             drop/throw celtic
         give/hand celtic to <something>
--

[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow
bowl, a luxuriously soft oval amethyst rug with a gold fleur-de-lys in the
center and thick gold fringe, and a personal hoverpallet here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.

l
[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.
You can go up.
enter shooting
[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.
enter shooting
Board what?
l
[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. The status lights overhead
are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage. The hatch appears to be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.
out
You exit the capsule.

ships
There are no other ships in the sector.
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
))7;3qOX/bS6=rkV!s=52uT8B0i?a1P"T^aF6vqy
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The two-person medium transport "Medium Slicer" has fired a grapple into a small
comet.

Salvage Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the two-person medium
transport "Rustbucket". The organization has earned 597,482.85 credits.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 14
Destroyers:
Three-Person Light Escort 15,000,000.00 (New Earth Blazing Trails)
AS-0A AEU LIGHT ESCORT VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 50 industry points        15 combat points
Model number: AS-0A                     Designation: Light Escort
Turret hardpoints: 10                   Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 10
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The light Escort is the first destroyer that an AEU pilot will ever have access
to. It's a reasonably well armed vessel, with no major bonuses. However, it can
still pack quite a punch, especially with more advanced upgrades and its single
launcher.
Three-Person Heavy Defense Vessel 7,500,000.00 (Endymion)
AD-1N AEU HEAVY DEFENSE VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 100 industry points       250 combat points
Model number: AD-1N                     Designation: Heavy Defense Vessel
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 4
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The defense vessel is a very well armed vessel, holding 12 turrets. It does have
a major disadvantage though, which likely also explains the cheaper cost. That
disadvantage is that it has no FTL drive. However, it can still be a very useful
ship, but just know if you want to take it anywhere you'll need to dock it
inside a bigger ship, or tug it around using a tugboat.
Three-Person Clipper 200,000,000.00 (New Earth Allied Technologies)
AS-4F AEU CLIPPER-CLASS ESCORT VESSEL
Class: Destroyer
Requirements: 750 industry points       750 combat points
Model number: AS-4F                     Designation: Clipper
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 14
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
The Clipper is the most advanced destroyer that the AEU has. It's as armed as
the defense vessel with 12 turrets, but has the further advantage of a vastly
increased engine speed when it's going at maximum burn, and also has an extra
hull failsafe over the other two destroyers.

l chair
a swiveling dark gray leather gunner's chair
This state of the art starship gunner's chair is upholstered in dark gray
leather and has a polished steel frame. The high back, seat, and armrests are
firmly but deeply padded to mitigate even the most extreme effects of starship
combat. The chair swivels smoothly from side to side to provide an extended
reach of weapon controls.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 18
Long-term rentals:
The fighter and heavy bomber listed in this section are generally similar to the
ones rented at Tannhauser, save for the fact that I'm pretty sure they start out
with stock upgrades and have to be upgraded by the long-term renter. The modular
tactical platform and the Modular Terrorerotici both can only have
corporation-based fighters such as the hyperion ships or the ones rented either
short-term or long-term by Agnar attached to them as far as we've deduced, as
well as the shuttles manufactured by corporations such as Hermes or United. You
can attach the ships to the platforms only from space. Note: the docking bay
size of the tactical platform and the Terrorerotici will increase depending on
the types of ships you have attached to them.

[Starship "Fireproof"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher and a dark red leather captain's chair here.
You can go down and out.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The five-person pulsar "Critical Strike", the luxury sightseer "Explorer 1", the
luxury sightseer "Explorer 2", the luxury sightseer "Explorer 3", and the
one-person hyperion security armoured warfare fighter "Fireproof" are landed
here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Demarco Scott strides in from a transparisteel doorway into the pilot lounge.
Fabious the arachnoid security robot skitters in after Demarco Scott.
Damien Alexander tramps in from a transparisteel doorway into the pilot lounge.
'So, put us in two of the sightseers.
You say, "So, put us in two of the sightseers."

onto an automated flatbed and slowly moved into a large garage.
Your ship 'Fireproof' has been automatically moved into a garage.

they?"
'Not necessarily.
You say, "Not necessarily."
Demarco Scott holds Damien Alexander's hand, taking him into his group.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The five-person pulsar "Critical Strike", the luxury sightseer "Explorer 1", the
luxury sightseer "Explorer 2", the luxury sightseer "Explorer 3", and the
five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "Janessa Ransom" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.

Frontier to sneak a site in before midnight."

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

Merchant 198" has jumped into the sector.

Merchant 198! Welcome to New Earth Orbit!"

New Earth.

The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "Janessa Ransom" has a compatible base

l
[Starship "Janessa Ransom"; "Explorer 2"]]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You can go down.
d
[Starship "Janessa Ransom"; Base Block]
You can go north, south, west, up, and down.

[Starship "Janessa Ransom"; Control Room]

post in AEU/Debate.

l
[Starship "Explorer 3"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see Fabious the arachnoid security robot here.
Demarco Scott and Damien Alexander are standing here.
You can go south and out.

[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The four-person mule "War Crimes", the advanced scout "Killer Cosmos!", and the
two-person light transport "Sydamien Pelastus" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, a trash can,
and a personal hoverpallet here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and down.
out

[Starship "War Crimes"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a busted decryogenesis device, a fuzzy stuffed eel, and Nova the little
black CatBot here.
Rogue Romano is standing here.
You can go south and out.

You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.

This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see the wreckage of Sentry Horde Replicator and Enhanced Warrior Alpha,
Cesar Ysidro (RATS Nanite Reinforcer), Rogue Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms), Damien
Alexander (AEU Utility Combatant), an energy bottle, and a portion of a RATS
constructor here.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see the wreckage of Sentry Horde Replicator and Enhanced Warrior Alpha,
Rogue Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms), Damien Alexander (AEU Utility Combatant),
Cesar Ysidro (RATS Nanite Reinforcer), and a one-use repair drone here.
You can go northeast and southwest.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see the wreckage of Overseeing Replicating Kinetic Sentinel Alpha, Rogue
Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms), Cesar Ysidro (RATS Nanite Reinforcer), Damien
Alexander (AEU Utility Combatant), and a small pile of half-synthesized metals
here.
You can go northeast, southwest, and northwest.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

Cesar Ysidro (RATS Nanite Reinforcer)
This is a strangely organic-looking battlesuit of shades of black and gray. It
resembles some sort of large humanoid robot. A rounded cockpit encases the
pilot's torso, while the pilot's arms and legs extend into a framework of
hydraulics and cables with some protective plating. A laser attachment is
mounted to the right wrist. A nanite replicator with a small targeting laser is
mounted to the right forearm. A wide-dispersal nanite replicator is mounted to
the left forearm.
It appears to be 0% damaged.

MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds

   Greatly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MAJOR GROUP REPAIR
   Greatly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds

   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE
   Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
KNOCKOUT
   Makes a single target unresponsive indefinitely, or until it is hit.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 12 seconds

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

l
[Starship "Daisy May"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small yellow ball containing some rattling beads, a silky purple
cushion decorated with embroidered pale purple lotus blossoms, a glossy gold

[Starship "Daisy May"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small yellow ball containing some rattling beads, a silky purple
cushion decorated with embroidered pale purple lotus blossoms, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, an overstuffed sofa upholstered in brilliantly colored
patchwork fabric, a large oval white and light yellow cloth rug, Emmylou the
humanoid service robot, a large green soldier felo kitten, an old hefty green
soldier felo, and Nova the little black CatBot here.
Lily Kaise and Rogue Romano are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Rogue Romano says in a Ticulian accent, "Mah first time with this thing."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Woo you'll do fine."
An old hefty green soldier felo marches out.
Lily Kaise smiles.

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[Ventilation Tunnels; Entry Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This appears to be an access point to a space station's large ventilation
system. Though, saying that, it doesn't appear quite large enough for a
battlesuit, and the presence of the heavy powered armor appears to be distending
the metal somewhat. But anything is better than a ventilation system filled with
giant bugs and mold!

Lily Kaise (EAOS Elementalist)
This is a slim, almost delicate-looking battlesuit, painted dark silver all
over. It resembles some sort of large humanoid robot. A slim cockpit encases the
pilot's torso, while the pilot's arms and legs extend into a framework of
hydraulics and cables with some protective plating. A laser attachment is
mounted to the right wrist. A large plasma cannon is mounted to the left
forearm, a neutronium-laced metal tube leading to a large tank on the back of
the suit. A set of protective light armor plating covers much of the suit. A
secondary attachment with a small plasma duct, several defensive lasers, and an
EMM is mounted to the left shoulder.
It appears to be 0% damaged.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Four-Way Junction] (inside a battlesuit)
Here, a single straight tunnel intersects with another straight tunnel. Through
the magic of topology, this intersection of two things actually creates four
equally exciting paths!
You see the corpse of Bari Mold Fehu, Cesar Ysidro (League Paladin), Ali Candan
(EAOS Alchemist), Lily Kaise (EAOS Elementalist), Damien Alexander (Mutuality
Jack-of-all-Trades), and Rogue Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms) here.
You can go north, east, south, and west.

molds."
Lily Kaise nods.
Cesar Ysidro looks at Ali Candan thoughtfully.
Damien Alexander asks in a Tenosque accent, "Does it help if more'n one of us
uses it?"
Cesar Ysidro shrugs.
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "No idea."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "I do think it stacks."
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "Can't hurt."
Damien Alexander nods.
Ali Candan grins.
Damien Alexander says in a Tenosque accent, "Didn't think molds had that tough
armour."
Cesar Ysidro says to Ali Candan, "No minimods?"
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "They got the toughest."

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Bari Mold Alpha here.
You can go north and south.

here."
