[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see the corpse of Bari Mold Alpha, Cesar Ysidro (League Paladin), Lily Kaise
(EAOS Elementalist), Rogue Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms), Ali Candan (EAOS
Alchemist), and Damien Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades) here.
You can go north and west.
peer n
You peer north...

one can go that other way. The possibilities are endless!

You can go north, east, and south.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Bari Mold Alpha, Cesar Ysidro (League Paladin), Damien Alexander
(Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades), Ali Candan (EAOS Alchemist), Lily Kaise (EAOS

[Ventilation Tunnels; Four-Way Junction] (inside a battlesuit)
Here, a single straight tunnel intersects with another straight tunnel. Through
the magic of topology, this intersection of two things actually creates four
equally exciting paths!
You see the corpse of Bari Vine Cluster Alpha, Cesar Ysidro (League Paladin),
Ali Candan (EAOS Alchemist), Damien Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades),
Rogue Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms), and Lily Kaise (EAOS Elementalist) here.
You can go north, east, south, and west.
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "We'll go north."
peer n
You peer north...
[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Bari Worker Horde Alpha here.
You can go north and south.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Cesar Ysidro (League Paladin), Ali Candan (EAOS Alchemist), Damien
Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades), Rogue Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms), and
Lily Kaise (EAOS Elementalist) here.
You can go north and south.
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "We'll pause for a bit."
Lily Kaise nods.
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "Shule tell a funny joke."
Lily Kaise grins.
Rogue Romano grins.
Damien idly hums the CatBot jingle.
'I don't know any funny jokes.
You say, "I don't know any funny jokes."
Cesar points his explosive harpoon at Shule Elemmire.
Cesar points his explosive harpoon at you.
Rogue Romano frowns at you.
Damien says to you in a Tenosque accent, "Then tell an unfunny joke."
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "You're under the mistaken
impression this is optional."
Damien Alexander laughs.
chuckle

[Ventilation Tunnels; Dead End] (inside a battlesuit)

greeted with a pile of mold probably eliminates it.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Bari Worker Horde Alpha here.
You can go east and west.

molds die before workers?"

first."
Rogue Romano says in a Ticulian accent, "I'm not sure. Don do this often."
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "He seemed to be rather hardened
compared to his solo friends."
Damien Alexander says in a Tenosque accent, "Not sure either."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "They're just both evil."

here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

Cesar Ysidro (League Paladin)
This is a thick heavy battlesuit, painted a mottled crimson with subdued dark
blue trim. It resembles some sort of large humanoid robot. A bulky cockpit
encases the pilot's torso, while the pilot's arms and legs extend into a
framework of hydraulics and cables with some protective plating. A projectile
weapon attachment is mounted to the right wrist. A large attachment with a flare
launcher, targeting lasers, and many floodlights is mounted on the back of the
suit. A minidrone applicator is attached to the left wrist, a hose leading to a
bulky device on the back of the suit. A set of very thick armor plating covers
much of the suit.
It appears to be 1% damaged.

l
[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Cesar Ysidro (League Paladin), Damien Alexander (Mutuality
Jack-of-all-Trades), Ali Candan (EAOS Alchemist), Lily Kaise (EAOS
Elementalist), and Rogue Romano (Fringe Man-At-Arms) here.
You can go south and west.
peer w
You peer west...
[Ventilation Tunnels; Exit] (inside a battlesuit)
Is this it? Is this finally the other end of the ventilation system? The
destruction that has been wrought to reach this point... This is one ventilation
subsection that won't see Bari again for a while!
You see a large, pulsating cocoon and Bari Worker Horde Alpha here.
You can go east.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Woo."
grin

team of battlesuits. It is time for you to lead a megapod raid."
Damien Alexander laughs.
tra gen You mean, I won't have to live down here forever?

Nova the little black CatBot trots happily in after Rogue Romano with a quiet
hiss of hydraulics.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Cesar Ysidro presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Daisy May!
Welcome to home space!"
Cesar Ysidro presses some buttons on the sensor control board.
A few green lights blink on, then off again a moment later, as another starship
is scanned.  The computer then displays the following:
AS-4F AEU Clipper-class Escort Vessel "Obliteration" [a]
--
IFF Transponder Code: AEU (Protected by sector naval forces)
Model Designation: AS-4F
Hull damage: 0%
Average damage: 0%
Occupancy: Unfilled
FTL Capable: Yes
Weapons: Powered down
Power: Charged
Cargo: Ammunition and low-grade dry felo chow
Coordinates: (5, 16, 5)
Distance: 19
--
Lily Kaise glides in from the south.
Cesar Ysidro presses some buttons on the communication board.
Via general sector communication, this ship transmits a text-based transmission:
"No"
Damien Alexander tramps in from the south.
Lily Kaise gives a credit chip to Cesar Ysidro.
Lily Kaise removes a credit chip from a coral pink silk handbag embroidered with
pastel dragonflies.
Cesar Ysidro shakes a credit chip for some reason.
Lily Kaise gives you a credit chip.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Hope I didn't miss anyone heh."
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "You missed Nova."
-lily Thanks
You say to Lily, "Thanks."
You notice Cesar Ysidro using the radio to ask for landing clearance.
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "She guarded the fort."
Lily Kaise exclaims in a New Earth accent, "Thanks all!"
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Daisy May. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
Rogue Romano says in a Ticulian accent, "Aww, poor Nova."
Nova the little black CatBot tilts its head and mews in confusion.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Was fun1."
A frisky hefty green cyclops felo suddenly rushes south.
drain chip
You drain 10,000,000.00 EAOS credits from a credit chip and discard it in a
nearby waste disposal unit.
The computer informs you that you have mail waiting, which may be picked up at
New Earth; Spaceport Mail Room.
Cesar Ysidro salutes sharply.
Lily Kaise pulls a large lever towards her.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
Cesar Ysidro moves out.
The airlock hatch chimes quietly.
out
[Starship "Daisy May"; Airlock]
You see a crudely hammered scrap metal feeding trough, a felo nest, an old hefty
green soldier felo, and an obese green twin tailed felo here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
You exit the ship.
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The four-person mule "Daisy May" and the three-person clipper "Obliteration" are
landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
Cesar Ysidro is standing here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Your battlesuit is automatically transferred to the spaceport.
enter dove
Cesar Ysidro knocks calmly upon the hull of the three-person clipper
"Obliteration".
You key in a transport of William Dove to your location.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is slowly brought in
aboard an automated flatbed, then lowered to the floor.
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow
bowl, a luxuriously soft oval amethyst rug with a gold fleur-de-lys in the
center and thick gold fringe, and a personal hoverpallet here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter dove
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.
sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.
i
 You are wearing a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of slim Sahara sand
linen trousers, and a pair of gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are
wearing a pair of white cotton briefs. You are also wearing a keychain, a
metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold
wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a backpack. You are concealing a
flight control scanner, a leather briefcase, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling
supply kit, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a black flightbag
with a red shooting star on the side, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black
engineering tool case, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, and a
scorched metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows,
both forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying a copy of "An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades" in your
right hand.

briefcase.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.
You see a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a small yellow ball
containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a white four poster rattan bed
with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of
lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed
pillow on it, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a small oval
turquoise rattan table with a glass top, and Xavier the big silver soldier felo
here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a
large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

yourself and you don't have a stun weapon.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.
You see a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a small yellow ball
containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a white four poster rattan bed
with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of
lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed
pillow on it, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a small oval
turquoise rattan table with a glass top, and Xavier the big silver soldier felo
here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a
large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, a violet leather

and teal aquatic life and sea green and neon blue round rocks, a small orange
ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale pink ceramic

stars, a pair of slim navy blue linen trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki
canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs

touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, and a backpack. You are concealing a flight control

thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a black flightbag with a red
shooting star on the side, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black engineering tool
case, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, and a scorched metal
thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are
left uncovered.

This is a broad, unforgiving expanse of jagged rock and regolith. Lights shining

being in total darkness. The light forms shadows with sharp edges, highlighting
every boulder and dangerous peak.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

power

from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
The computer reports that the five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William
Dove" has launched from New Earth.

drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Base Block]

seashells, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a round white rattan dining table with a glass top, a blueberry

l felo
a glossy slate blue ceramic felo chow bowl
The bowl is still almost entirely full.
l last felo
Bert the hefty blue soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is hefty in size and covered in short, light-tipped blue fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
long, thin legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, straight black claws,
visible only when not retracted. A blue, square nose sits below a pair of bright
green eyes with horizontal pupils. It is wearing a sparkling sapphire collar. It
also has a pair of sapphire blue satin tail ribbons tied in bows.

read letter
--
Interalliance Insurance
00:00  3 August 2316 GST
To Shule Elemmire, Valued Policy Holder:
The total payment due for the upcoming period is 28,144,515.70 AEU credits.
This amount has been partly paid from the balance you held with us, which was
7,036,128.93 AEU credits.
Please pay the balance of 21,108,386.77 AEU credits by 00:00  7 August 2316 GST.
As always, we greatly value your business.
--

You peer out...
[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The one-person cargo hauler "Tony's Delivery Shuttle", the two-person Accord
gemini "Gtr Beni Gittiin Yere", the four-person mule "White Dove", and the
five-person strike gunboat "Kartal" are landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.
Ali Candan just arrived.
Ali Candan waves.
Ali Candan sits down on a cushy booth seat.
wave ali
You wave to Ali Candan.
Ali Candan speaks into his metachannel FTL communicator and watch:
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "What's your ETA, Ted?"
A bit of movement out of the corner of your eye draws your attention to the
nearest holovid, where the image of a ship can be seen landing on the outside
landing pad. An informative bit of text below it identifies it as the
vostok-class capsule "The Atocha Star".
[General Communication] Damien Alexander transmits, "Uh-oh."
who

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see the wreckage of Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Alpha, the
wreckage of Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Beta, Ted Warburton (AISSF
Rental Advanced Combat Armour), Damien Alexander (AEU Utility Combatant), and
Ali Candan (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) here.

enter

launch

two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.

[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.
You see Ted Warburton (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) and Ali Candan
(AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) here.
You can go southwest.
A drop pod suddenly hurtles into the area, slowing its descent abruptly with a
burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Damien Alexander (AEU Utility Combatant).
weapons
WEAPONS
--
CYLINDER ACCELERATOR
   Module:     Projectile
   Ammunition: 125/138           Time To Fire: 9 seconds       
   Damage:     89 - 149          Splash Damage: none           
POWERED SHOTGUN
   Module:     Projectile
   Ammunition: 360/621           Time To Fire: 8 seconds       Shots Fired: 9
   Damage:     96 - 160          Splash Damage: none           Damage/Shot: 11 -
18
ABILITIES
--
FLARE
   Attracts attention from a group of enemies.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
FLASH
   Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop
what they were doing.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
ILLUMINATE
   Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
RADIATE
   Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
LASER GUIDANCE
   Augments your squad's accuracy.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 6 seconds
BLIND
   Blinds a single target for a period of time.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
DIRECTED FLARE
   Irritates and provokes a single target.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
ADVANCED RESOURCE DETECTION
   Scans for various resources.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
ACCELERATED RARE EARTHS EXTRACTION
   Extracts rare earths from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 6 seconds
SWIFT ARTIFACT EXTRACTION
   Extracts artifacts from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 10 seconds
Current Energy: 160/160

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You can go northeast and southwest.

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.

extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

wreckage of Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Beta, Ted Warburton (AISSF

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see the wreckage of Overseeing Replicating Kinetic Sentinel Alpha, Ali
Candan (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour), Ted Warburton (AISSF Rental
Advanced Combat Armour), Damien Alexander (AEU Utility Combatant), a one-use
repair drone, and an energy bottle here.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Alpha and Miniaturized
Interfacing Companion Entity Beta here.
You can go southeast and northwest.

[Starship "White Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a large leather couch, a metal table, a small red insulated cooler, a
personal hoverpallet, and a small black trash can here.
Ted Warburton is sitting on a large leather couch. Ali Candan and Damien
Alexander are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Ted Warburton says in a Candelarian accent, "One left for me."
Small clinks of metal come from the hull of the ship as it's being repaired.
You notice Ali Candan using the radio to ask for landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, White Dove. We read your League
transponder. You are cleared to land."
Ted Warburton scrambles to his feet.
Ted Warburton walks out.

brightly from the nearby asteroid outpost are all that keep the surface from

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Shooting
Star! Welcome to home space!"

about Cesar?"

[New Earth; Pilot Corps Liaison Office; Space Defense Captain]
This office is small but elegant, the recessed lighting shining softly over pale
green carpet, silvery white walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with
an ergonomically designed mesh and leather chair behind it. Arranged in front of
the desk are several other chairs, while ferns in white pots occupy the corners
of the office, and on the walls are framed images of sleek AEU starships. The
door is open.
You see the Space Defense Captain terminal and a large metal filing cabinet
here.
You can go east.

space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer

almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.

This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.

sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
k7-U]a3I/*1rCRDvR8i1?Nkr1?>2kn.ON;&8SaZe
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Damien Alexander is standing here.

l
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole
drive tracer, a black leather sofa, and a steel plaque engraved with the phrase
"Reminder: This ship is equipped with a sensor dampening array." here.
Ted Warburton is sitting on a black leather sofa. Kim Saunders, Lily Kaise, and
Damien Alexander are standing here.
You can go south and out.
You hear hammering and the chatter of technicians outside as the spaceport
repairs the starship.

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
Kim Saunders says in a New Bristol accent, "It's a good team."
Lily Kaise frowns at you.
Ted Warburton says in a Candelarian accent, "Definitely."

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.

reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole
drive tracer, a black leather sofa, and a steel plaque engraved with the phrase
"Reminder: This ship is equipped with a sensor dampening array." here.
Ted Warburton, Kim Saunders, Damien Alexander, and Lily Kaise are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Would you like to request docking clearance for AFW Command (Dock One)?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to dock.
A voice says over the speaker, "Roger, cleared to land at this Accord of Free
Worlds port."
out
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
Lily Kaise, Kim Saunders, Damien Alexander, and Ted Warburton followed you.
out
You exit the ship.
[Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay One]
The one-person marauder "Burn, Don't Freeze", the one-person fighter "Gambit",
the one-person cargo hauler "Current Mood", the one-person supply shuttle
"Shangri-la Terraform Group 179", the four-person Accord space module transport
"Building Blocks For Adults Are Way Underrated", the two-person Accord space
module scout "Up Up And Away!", the two-person tugboat "Stick And Go", the
four-person Accord space module transport "Shadowed Sunset", the three-person
stalwart "Red In Tooth And Claw", the one-person cargo hauler "Expendable", and
the five-person pulsar "Critical Strike" are landed here.
You can go northeast, northwest, and up.
Lily Kaise, Kim Saunders, Damien Alexander, and Ted Warburton followed you.

You suddenly float up into the air as the ship's artificial gravity abruptly
switches off, and you feel your hair stand on end as the ship projects an
electromagnetic field around you. Suddenly, every seam of the ship seems to come
apart, exposing you to space. You quickly close your eyes as the vacuum pulls at
your skin and the electromagnetic field tugs you rapidly toward a starship
rescue pod.
Your right leg has been injured!
The limb seems to be broken.
[Critical Strike Rescue Pod]
You can go nowhere.
The pod simply drifts for a moment as its automatic navigation systems come
online. Then it smoothly maneuvers through the wreckage of the starship and out
into open space.
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator chirps quietly as it receives a
new notice.

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

[Starship "Fait Accompli"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a soft abstractly shaped ocean blue rug with a
design of coral and cream waves, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a shiny
round deep purple table with a painted tablecloth in a vivid patchwork pattern,
an overstuffed sofa upholstered in brilliantly colored patchwork fabric, a small
white trash bin, and a wormhole drive tracer here.
Lily Kaise is lying down.
You can go south and out.

[Endymion Spaceport; Landing Pad]
It is night-time here, the roughly circular landing pad lit only by several
small spotlights mounted around the edges of its rough concrete surface. With
the exception of sprawling warehouses to the east and southwest, the buildings
here are of sun-bleached adobe, with darkly tinted glass at the small square
windows. Beyond the spaceport is the desert. The night sky is filled with stars,
with a brilliant curtain of shifting lights stretching across the north.
The two-person bolt thrower "Danube", the two-person bolt thrower "Ready, Aim,
Fire", and the five-person pulsar "Fait Accompli" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a trash can here.

ftl drydock
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.

battlecruiser-class starship.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator beeps insistently as it receives
a new notice.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
read comm
You glance at your communicator's screen.
Notice from the Space Defense Captain: Greetings AEU! Old Frontier Processor is
once again cleansed of bari. Thanks to all those who participated. Come asteroid
mine, purchase upgrades, and drink and lounge to your heart's delight. [18:05  3
August 2316 GST]
Notice from the Voice of the Corps: Good day AEU. Just a reminder that there is
a proposal to vote upon via our Conference Room voting machine. This vote will
remain open until Sunday, August 7th, 2316. The proposal is as follows - Should
here be established a short term fund To aid and assist AEU citizens who cannot
afford the use of our Capitol planet's Medical Creche in the New Phoenix area on
a trial basis. Funding would be used to locate candidates for upgraded
treatment, and for the treatment itself? [21:34  3 August 2316 GST]
You have three mail messages.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Critical
Strike! Welcome to home space!"

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" and the five-person
pulsar "Critical Strike" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are
left uncovered.

7
Macros & Scripting
Macros are commands that let you perform complex actions instantly with a couple
of keystrokes; for instance, a command that allows you to immediately stun
another character and flee into your ship without delay. If engaging in conflict
with another player or otherwise in competition with others, you must do so on
level ground. This "level ground" is the game's built-in output and command
parsing, neither of which require significant alteration to make the game
playable, regardless of the player's individual circumstances.
Scripting is perhaps even worse, and involves complex programs that completely
automate some process in the game, usually something that generates money or
other rewards from game activities. This is, obviously, unfair to other players
that put real work into their characters.
Two things are specifically disallowed, though this is not a complete list:
1) Any alias, trigger, or script that sends input to the game (that is, enters
commands for you automatically, or shortens multi-line commands into one
command).
2) Any command bound to a single key.
In general, any client-based system that you might use to bypass the usual
typing required to accomplish something that impacts your character (such as
combat gunning, salvaging, and so on), in order to perform tasks faster or more
easily than normal human capabilities, is likely to be a violation of this
policy.
Other information:
   - We're fully aware that the capability for macros and scripts is built right
into several MOO/MUD clients. We're also aware that many players have received a
"soundpack" with a suite of macros and triggers built in. This doesn't mean that
you should be using them. Scripting is acceptable in some games, but this is not
one of them.
   - We have systems in place that automatically analyze player actions and
alert us to potential scripting, and we also have over ten years of experience
in directly observing and detecting scripters. Yes, we can tell when you're
doing it. And while you may believe you're getting away with it, we will often
bide our time and attempt to see if any other player is using the same script,
since they tend to spread. But in the end, we will catch up to you.
   - Command stacking (that is, copying and pasting in order to send multiple
commands to the game in one line of input, or all at once) and autocorrect
systems cannot be differentiated from use of a macro or alias, and will be
treated the same if they end up allowing you to perform beyond normal human
capabilities.
   - You should avoid excessive parsing of output. This includes adding
client-side "commands" to the game, applying stored output to inputted commands,
or gagging any essential information that the game provides. Classic examples
generally involve gunning and include a "retrack" command, an automatic addition
of the last tracked location to the "aim" command, and the gagging of
identifying information in tracking output.
   - Triggers which are purely for accessibility (i.e., adding sounds or colored
highlights to the game) are allowed.
   - If you act like a robot, you will be punished for scripting regardless of
the specific methodology you used. The difference between robotic behavior and
human behavior is night and day, we CAN tell when you're doing it, and we WILL
eventually level the playing field.

policy 
STAR CONQUEST POLICY
--
[1] Overview
[2] Roleplaying
[3] Disruption, Harassment, and Discrimination
[4] Maintaining a Newbie-Friendly Game
[5] Game Integrity & Bug Abuse
[6] Workarounds of Game Limitations
[7] Macros & Scripting
[8] Interactions With Hosts & Squidsoft.net Staff
[9] Metagaming & Multiple Characters
[10] Lag, Downtime, and Loss
[11] Privacy
[12] Changes to the Game and Game Policy
[13] Intellectual Property and Creative Works
[14] Roleplay-Related Minievents

7
Macros & Scripting
Macros are commands that let you perform complex actions instantly with a couple
of keystrokes; for instance, a command that allows you to immediately stun
another character and flee into your ship without delay. If engaging in conflict
with another player or otherwise in competition with others, you must do so on
level ground. This "level ground" is the game's built-in output and command
parsing, neither of which require significant alteration to make the game
playable, regardless of the player's individual circumstances.
Scripting is perhaps even worse, and involves complex programs that completely
automate some process in the game, usually something that generates money or
other rewards from game activities. This is, obviously, unfair to other players
that put real work into their characters.
Two things are specifically disallowed, though this is not a complete list:
1) Any alias, trigger, or script that sends input to the game (that is, enters
commands for you automatically, or shortens multi-line commands into one
command).
2) Any command bound to a single key.
In general, any client-based system that you might use to bypass the usual
typing required to accomplish something that impacts your character (such as
combat gunning, salvaging, and so on), in order to perform tasks faster or more
easily than normal human capabilities, is likely to be a violation of this
policy.
Other information:
   - We're fully aware that the capability for macros and scripts is built right
into several MOO/MUD clients. We're also aware that many players have received a
"soundpack" with a suite of macros and triggers built in. This doesn't mean that
you should be using them. Scripting is acceptable in some games, but this is not
one of them.
   - We have systems in place that automatically analyze player actions and
alert us to potential scripting, and we also have over ten years of experience
in directly observing and detecting scripters. Yes, we can tell when you're
doing it. And while you may believe you're getting away with it, we will often
bide our time and attempt to see if any other player is using the same script,
since they tend to spread. But in the end, we will catch up to you.
   - Command stacking (that is, copying and pasting in order to send multiple
commands to the game in one line of input, or all at once) and autocorrect
systems cannot be differentiated from use of a macro or alias, and will be
treated the same if they end up allowing you to perform beyond normal human
capabilities.
   - You should avoid excessive parsing of output. This includes adding
client-side "commands" to the game, applying stored output to inputted commands,
or gagging any essential information that the game provides. Classic examples
generally involve gunning and include a "retrack" command, an automatic addition
of the last tracked location to the "aim" command, and the gagging of
identifying information in tracking output.
   - Triggers which are purely for accessibility (i.e., adding sounds or colored
highlights to the game) are allowed.
   - If you act like a robot, you will be punished for scripting regardless of
the specific methodology you used. The difference between robotic behavior and
human behavior is night and day, we CAN tell when you're doing it, and we WILL
eventually level the playing field.

Penalized under policy 7
VERY IMPORTANT: Please enter any further details that might help the staff
address your issue. In the case of a bug, please try to include all information
necessary for the staff to research your issue: Exactly what did you do to
encounter the bug? What was the exact result? What was the exact text you
encountered? What result, exactly, were you expecting instead? Exactly what
steps could be taken to encounter the same issue again? If you have an issue
with a specific item, please include where we can find it. If you have an issue
with a ship, please include its exact name so we can find it. The less detail
we're given, the less likely it is we'll be able to fix the issue.
[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]

violating policy 7. I'd like to know where I am suspected of using scripts or
macros.

knowledge AEU combat
Your knowledge of starship combat experience among AEU pilots:
   Lily Kaise has the most starship combat points among the AEU.
      She is also known for being the best at advanced engineering techniques,
the best with mission-related ship kills, excellent at combat gunning, and the
owner of an ASS-E7 Allied Starships Modular Tactical Platform.
   
   Ather Jammoa has a high amount of starship combat points among the AEU.
      He is also known for being the best at combat piloting, the best at damage
control, the best with invading ship kills, very good at combat gunning, and the
owner of an AH-12 AEU Soothsayer-class Cruiser.
   
   Angelica Torres has a good amount of starship combat points among the AEU.
      She is also known for being the best with minor skirmish ship kills, the
best at defending salvage operations, and the owner of an AH-12 AEU
Soothsayer-class Cruiser.
   
   Shule Elemmire has a good amount of starship combat points among the AEU.
      He is also known for being the best at combat gunning and the owner of an
AH-12b AEU Soothsayer-class Cruiser Mark II.
   
   Eli Grey has a good amount of starship combat points among the AEU.
      He is also known for being excellent at combat gunning and the owner of an
AH-12 AEU Soothsayer-class Cruiser.
   
   Kaito Zalmont has not very many starship combat points among the AEU.
      He is also known for being very good with invading ship kills, very good
at combat piloting, and the owner of an AR-7C AEU Pulsar-class Assault Gunship.

Subject:                 Penalized under policy 7
By:                      Shule Elemmire
Location:                Old Frontier Processor; Asteroid Mining
Originally submitted:    Wed Aug  3 22:21:54 2016 UTC

Message 1:
From the player...
On my points read out, I noticed that I have been penalised 50 points for
violating policy 7. I'd like to know where I am suspected of using scripts or
macros. 
--
Message 2:
From the staff, submitted on Wed Aug  3 2016 UTC...
The system frequently flags you for typing some longer commands at up to 30
times average human speed. We watched it long enough to determine it wasn't
simply a false positive (meaning that it seems to happen consistently across
many combats) and then applied the penalty.
--

times average human speed. We watched it long enough to determine it wasn't
simply a false positive (meaning that it seems to happen consistently across
many combats) and then applied the penalty.

FTL Interalliance Communications Network
--
Subject: A Pilot's Guide to Preparation
Author: Ather Jammoa
Posted: 20:19  3 August 2316 GST
--
Greetings pilots:
This book has been updated with a few minor revisions. Most notable among them
is that there is no longer a shopping book listed in the "other books to buy"
section. This is mainly due to the fact that Elizabeth, or Berry, or whatever
her name is has either retired, or is inactive for some reason. So, her book was
erased. Emma's has also been out of circulation for quite some time. Unless one
of these books is being sold in the alliance book stores, I don't see it
anywhere.
Feel free to buy the latest copy of the book to make sure that you are well
prepared!
--

[2] Return
[3] Reply
[4] Quit

l asteria
a Tardick lizard named Asteria
This is one of the famed Tardick lizards. It has four legs: a thick, strong back
pair and a foreshortened front pair. It seems to go on all fours most of the
time, but it also stands up occasionally, using its front paws as somewhat
awkward hands. Its toes have short but sharp talons. Its skin is dark gray and
spotted with dark green, and parallel rows of silver-colored ridges run down its
back to the tip of its long tail. Its yellow eyes betray little in the way of
curiosity. A slim dark pink tongue flicks out every few seconds. It is wearing a
slim leather collar with a tag reading ASTERIA.
pet asteria
You stroke a Tardick lizard named Asteria lovingly.
Lily Kaise dangles a day old slice of pinwheel pizza in front of a Tardick
lizard named Asteria. The lizard's tongue flicks out once, then its head lunges
forward, snapping up the food in a sudden blur and immediately swallowing it
whole.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "She was waiting for us."
Lily Kaise disbands her group.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.
You see a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a small yellow ball
containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a white four poster rattan bed
with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of
lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed
pillow on it, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a small oval
turquoise rattan table with a glass top, and a pair of sparkly white leather
clogs here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.

Message 1:
From the player...
On my points read out, I noticed that I have been penalised 50 points for
violating policy 7. I'd like to know where I am suspected of using scripts or
macros. 
--
Message 2:
From the staff, submitted on Wed Aug  3 2016 UTC...
The system frequently flags you for typing some longer commands at up to 30
times average human speed. We watched it long enough to determine it wasn't
simply a false positive (meaning that it seems to happen consistently across
many combats) and then applied the penalty.
--
Message 3:
From the player, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Ok...? Does it happen primarily when I'm gunning or flying?
--
Message 4:
From the staff, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Flying.

it invigorates your senses.

relaxed. Steam floats lazily in the enclosed space.

status
General Starship status:
HULL PLATING:                                                                   
    EAOS Plasma Resistant Plating (248 damage absorption points) (modified to
110% by hull size and rated at 100% of nominal) (Moderate resistance to
minicannons)
REACTIONLESS DRIVE:                                                             
    EAOS Dual Reactionless Mk III (Instantaneous velocity: 5714km/s, Maximum
velocity: 24000 km/s, Acceleration Rating: 25.0, Complete Deceleration in 5
seconds) (Running at 95% rated efficiency and 0% rated maximum velocity)
MAIN SENSORS:                                                                   
    EAOS Superstring Perturbation Sensor (Hull Lockon Rate: 25% Wormhole Drive
Lockon Rate: 50% Cloak Resolution Distance: 1 unit)
WEAPONS (Turrets):                                                              
    EAOS Crystalline Optics Laser Mk II is operating at 18 damage per turret
(120% of rated) and is operating at 100% of rated efficiency (Hull Accuracy
Added: 5% Time To Fire: 4s)
WEAPONS (Launchers):                                                            
    Jinu Salvage Miniaturized Plasma Cannon is operating at 100 damage per
launcher (100% of rated) and is operating at 100% of rated efficiency (Hull
Accuracy Added: 0% Time To Fire: 4s)
STORAGE:                                                                        
    Merchant-Grade Storage Compression (170% of standard)
MAIN BATTERY:                                                                   
    Revo Applied Technology Sink (Overall Efficiency: 100% Combat Grid Usage:
100% Wormhole Drive Usage: 100% Max Engine Speed: 6000km/s) (Maximum Charge:
100% of standard) (Drain Rate: n/a)
COMBAT ENERGY GRID:                                                             
    Telex Defense "Jackrabbit" Combat Accelerator (Capacity: 1100 Time To
Recharge: 200 seconds)  (modified to 100% by hull size)
TARGET TRACKING ARRAY:                                                          
    Luna Improved TT Array (Maximum Targets: 1 Range: 2 units Near Target
Retention: 100% Far Target Retention: 55%) (Retention improved by warship-grade
sensors)
LIFE SUPPORT:                                                                   
    Inactive
SENSOR DATA:                                                                    
    Includes Outsider Scan Signatures
SALVAGING EQUIPMENT:
  Salvage range:                                                                
    Normal
  Sensor:                                                                       
    stock salvage sensor (Range: 1)
  EMM:                                                                          
    stock salvage electromagnetic manipulator (Response Time: 3.0s)

    stock salvage grapple (Grade: 0 Strength: 4 Bonus Grade: 0)
  Storage Compressor:                                                           
    Functional

    Ready

    Functional

empty con
Are you sure you want to dump the contents of a "Critical Strike" salvage
container out? [Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You turn a "Critical Strike" salvage container over and dump the contents onto
the ground.
drop con
You drop a "Critical Strike" salvage container.
As soon as a "Critical Strike" salvage container hits the ground, it suddenly
shatters into a billion pieces, never to be seen again.
l

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a steel plaque engraved with the phrase
"Reminder: This ship is equipped with a sensor dampening array.", a wormhole
drive tracer, and a black leather captain's chair here.
You can go south and out.
out
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.
[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
You can go up.
enter fait
[Starship "Fait Accompli"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter fait

an overstuffed sofa upholstered in brilliantly colored patchwork fabric, a small

You begin familiarizing yourself with the engineering stations and making
various changes to your liking.
[Tactical Communication] Damien Alexander transmits, "Okay, I got time fer one
beacon, maybe more. Anybody interested?"
With everything arranged, you settle into the damage control station.
[Tactical Communication] Joel Kringle transmits, "I'm down."
[Tactical Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Sure."
[Tactical Communication] Joel Kringle transmits, "Woo wing very highs."
[General Communication] Cesar Ysidro transmits, "Bruh."
[Tactical Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "He hates wings."
[General Communication] Joel Kringle transmits, "What?"
[General Communication] Cesar Ysidro transmits, "The wing is the future."
[Tactical Communication] Damien Alexander transmits, "No wing here."

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive and an overstuffed red chair here.
You can go north and south.

Pilot Kerry Rodriguez
He appears to be 31 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
fair skin. His body is firm with muscled hips and well-muscled calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a muscular chest. His face is average-shaped and
handsome, with an average nose and dimpled chin. His lips are soft and
occasionally part to reveal a set of white teeth. Beneath a set of thin
eyebrows, his eyes are blue and almond-shaped. His short, curly hair is light
brown and neatly combed.
His right arm is bruised. 
 He is wearing a blue polo with a turned up collar, a fancy gold watch with
diamond accents, a pair of pleated black dress trousers with a silk satin stripe
down the outside seams, and a pair of thick black cotton loafer socks. He is
also wearing an indigo metachannel FTL communicator, an alliance information
assistant, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a sturdy navy blue
canvas League backpack, a black camera with a chain link strap, a deep royal
blue fleur-de-lys ring, a glowing neon blue ring, a baby blue touch einrophone
in a black leather phone holster, a gold Leo keychain, a temporary space station
reference device, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a thick synthleather bandolier
with large pockets, and a silvery band inset with a real diamond. His head,
face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, left wrist, and both hands
are left uncovered.
He is carrying Kerry Rodriguez's workbench in his left hand.

[1] Confirmation bypass when gunning (Staff Response)
[2] Error when checking mail (Acknowledged/Closed)
[3] Penalized under policy 7 (Staff Response)

[4] New Support Request
Enter your selection:
3
--
Subject:                 Penalized under policy 7
By:                      Shule Elemmire
Location:                Old Frontier Processor; Asteroid Mining
Originally submitted:    Wed Aug  3 22:21:54 2016 UTC
Last followup:           Thu Aug  4 16:53:29 2016 UTC
Staff response expected: No
--
Message 1:
From the player...
On my points read out, I noticed that I have been penalised 50 points for
violating policy 7. I'd like to know where I am suspected of using scripts or
macros. 
--
Message 2:
From the staff, submitted on Wed Aug  3 2016 UTC...
The system frequently flags you for typing some longer commands at up to 30
times average human speed. We watched it long enough to determine it wasn't
simply a false positive (meaning that it seems to happen consistently across
many combats) and then applied the penalty.
--
Message 3:
From the player, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Ok...? Does it happen primarily when I'm gunning or flying?
--
Message 4:
From the staff, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Flying.
--
Message 5:
From the player, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Could you provide an example? I'd like to fix whatever it is I'm doing wrong.
--
Message 6:
From the staff, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
It is usually the "move" command entered at 1000+ WPM. Some other commands tend
to be entered in suspiciously full and perfect states, though they are less
clear-cut. Most commands that you need to use quickly already have shorter
aliases: m, sc, and so on.
--
Do you wish to send a followup message under this ticket?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
Ted Warburton walks in from below.
Ted Warburton walks south.
n
Goodbye!
The starship transitions into another sector.
Ted Warburton walks in from the south.
Ted Warburton walks down.
The starship transitions into another sector.

You earn 5,000,000.00 AEU credits for a successful beacon drop, plus a kill
bonus of 4,125,000.00 AEU credits.
You earn a bonus of 3,573,958.33 AEU credits for submitting information to a
battle analysis scanner on a temporary space station.
456,250.00 credits of your income have gone toward your organization.
[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has gained 6,889,040.47 credits
for a submission from a battle analysis scanner on Fringe Battle-Scanning
Nuclear Temporary Station involving the five-person mass production scythe "Rage
And Terror".
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as

bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly

Recent Support Tickets
--
[1] Confirmation bypass when gunning (Staff Response)
[2] Error when checking mail (Acknowledged/Closed)
[3] Penalized under policy 7 (Staff Response)
--
[4] New Support Request
Enter your selection:
3
--
Subject:                 Penalized under policy 7
By:                      Shule Elemmire
Location:                Old Frontier Processor; Asteroid Mining
Originally submitted:    Wed Aug  3 22:21:54 2016 UTC
Last followup:           Thu Aug  4 16:53:29 2016 UTC
Staff response expected: No
--
Message 1:
From the player...
On my points read out, I noticed that I have been penalised 50 points for
violating policy 7. I'd like to know where I am suspected of using scripts or
macros. 
--
Message 2:
From the staff, submitted on Wed Aug  3 2016 UTC...
The system frequently flags you for typing some longer commands at up to 30
times average human speed. We watched it long enough to determine it wasn't
simply a false positive (meaning that it seems to happen consistently across
many combats) and then applied the penalty.
--
Message 3:
From the player, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Ok...? Does it happen primarily when I'm gunning or flying?
--
Message 4:
From the staff, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Flying.
--
Message 5:
From the player, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
Could you provide an example? I'd like to fix whatever it is I'm doing wrong.
--
Message 6:
From the staff, submitted on Thu Aug  4 2016 UTC...
It is usually the "move" command entered at 1000+ WPM. Some other commands tend
to be entered in suspiciously full and perfect states, though they are less
clear-cut. Most commands that you need to use quickly already have shorter
aliases: m, sc, and so on.
--
Do you wish to send a followup message under this ticket?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "I see some
activity underway, but no performance goals reached yet! Let's keep going!"
y
Please enter your followup message.
[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]
Oh, ok. I think I know whats going on in regards to the move command. My
guess is I type the move command, am reminded that I need to be on autopilot,
switch to autopilot, and then when I send the move command again, the system is
flagging it as being typed really fast. If this is the case, I'm simply typing
the command, forgetting I need to be on autopilot, switching to autopilot when
reminded, and then arrowing up and pressing enter since the command is in my
command history already. However, I'll stop using the command history for that.
Thanks for letting me know.
*
.
Thank you. The staff have received your followup message.
Lily Kaise speaks into her metachannel FTL communicator:

of planets! I can't satisfy your begathon this week."

and jets off.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, Purr the humanoid service robot,
and a compact red refrigerator here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.

lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
